pros: Great CEOs, many smart, capable employees
cons: pay is not in line with cost of living increases

pros: the benefits are really good
cons: I got wrote up the 2nd day my mom was in the ICU. I was also denied the request to go to my grandparents funeral. If you are on FMLA you will be harassed. I have felt dehumanized

job_title: Special Projects Coordinator in Anchorage, AK
pros: Great benefits, good coworkers, beautiful setting.
cons: Little opportunity for growth, easy to overwork and not be compensated.

pros: Good to work for the native community.
cons: Can be very slow moving.

pros: Job Security and great benefits
cons: Lower than average starting wages

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Anchorage, AK
pros: Really enjoy the people I work with. We have an awesome scheduler. We are all supported to grow in our career and/or education.
cons: As most places, I believe there is a disconnect between upper management and frontline staff. Hoping to see this improve. Pay could be better/more competitive with other hospitals in town.

pros: Great benefits and PTO. Nice coworkers.
cons: Great expectations and very little training. No mentors for new employees.

job_title: Certified Pharmacy Technician in Anchorage, AK
pros: awesome company to work for
cons: nothing to complain about ever

job_title: Human Resources Assistant in Anchorage, AK
pros: Room for advancement. Great benefits. Great co-workers.
cons: Forces employees to get the covid vaccine or termination for not complying to the mandate. Have to follow federal guidelines even they claim sovereignty. Deny your constitutional rights based on claiming sovereignty and still receive federal funds that I contribute tax funds to as an employee.

job_title: Certified Medical Assistant in Anchorage, AK
pros: Great hours. Love the location. Helping my own people.
cons: Prices in cafeteria are too high.

pros: Incredible vision to make Alaska Natives the healthiest people in the world.
cons: Rehiring people who have had issues in the past.

pros: Nice building, well staffed which is not usually the case in hospitals
cons: Very little PTO for the first several years

job_title: Senior Program Manager in Anchorage, AK
pros: Very meaningful work, good work culture, good salary range, and benefits package.
cons: Can be a little cold and corporate feeling.

pros:
- My manager is flexible and understanding
- Great mission and vision
cons: - A lot of bureaucracy

review_title: Strong mission to serve Alaska Native communities and promote all aspects of health
pros:
High quality health services paired with public health and structural interventions
Wide range of opportunities
Managers value professional development
Strong mission and leadership
cons:
Silos between public health, environment/engineering, and healthcare due to funding streams and organizational structure
Little integration or cooperation of analytic teams from BI, hospital operations, and epidemiology

pros: Great Mission, flexibility and work environment
cons: Excellent Benefits. Pay average, but normal for a non-profit.

pros: benefits, retirement, PTO, coworkers, work from home flexibility
cons: growth, salary increases, process improvement

pros: there is awesome pay and people
cons: it can be very short staffed

pros: Great health, PTO, and education benefits.
cons: No merit based raises and large divide between those that make minimal salaries and those that make six figures.

cons: Some health care professionals treat lower job titles poorly

pros: Great company to work for
cons: Tech support is lacking for remote employees

pros: Community oriented organization with meaningful work
cons: Limited advancement opportunities in multiple departments

review_title: Nice people, unclear on job duties
pros: Nice people, challenging career, good benefits.
cons: Little or no training, supervisors kept changing their mind on my duties, I never knew what I was supposed to be doing next.

job_title: Medical Records Clerk in Anchorage, AK
pros: I was able to work nights. My team of coworkers were amazing.
cons: There was not enough staff.

job_title: Instructional Designer III in Anchorage, AK
pros: ANTHC is a great place to work!
cons: I don't have any cons so far.

job_title: Medical Billing Specialist III in Anchorage, AK
pros: They show that they value their employees with amazing benefits, annual employee surveys, and making changes as needed for their employees. It has a family oriented feel to the work environment. The department I was in had flexible schedules, education assistance, and department potlucks and other activities.
cons: The department had roughly 50-60 people at any given time, turnover was lower than my previous jobs, but limited growth opportunities within the department.

pros: Great benefits and a good PTO accrual
cons: Average pay in comparison to other hospitals

job_title: Director, Information Security in Anchorage, AK
pros: Good place to work and the people are nice
cons: Far from work location to my house

review_title: Excellent Company But Not Much Room For Growth
pros: Great benefits, interesting work, great people.
cons: Little room for growth or job expansion.

job_title: IT Service Desk Specialist in Anchorage, AK
pros:
People
Work life balance
Benefits are great.
cons: Pay leaves something to be desired.

review_title: Poor Management, Poor Pay and Poor Communication
pros: Clean environment, great medical director.
cons: Despite having such an incredible source of funding I have the wage rate to be 15-35% lower than other hospitals and private clinics in that area. My co-workers disclosed their pay rates, and we found ourselves with a similar rate of pay. Management was horrible. Management was negative and unpleasant. There was a lack of communication amongst the department. As an employee of ANTHC I felt I was treated poorly. I felt I did not have a voice. I did not feel comfortable working here.

job_title: Prior Authorization Specialist in Anchorage, AK
pros: It's a steady job and you will very much be in need, you'll have an opportunity to make a lot more doing overtime which will be required.
cons: You will spend most days working 1-3 hours past your schedule just to handle the workload.

job_title: Medical Technologist II in Anchorage, AK
pros: ANTHC is an amazing place to work with some of the most up-to-date analytical equipment in the industry!
cons: Seniority based decisions aren't always the best and often times minimize great new talent that may be available to bring in.

pros: Benefits are awesome. People are great.
cons: Technology is behind by ten years.

pros: Helping people in rural Alaska
cons: Management is incompetent.  Wastes resources that could be used where they are needed rather than to support a bloated and inefficient bureaucracy.

pros: Helping the population achieve health
cons: Getting through HR is a nightmare, long wait times, sometimes resumes aren't passed along

pros: Everyone is willing to help.
cons: The drive to Anchorage is pretty hectic.

pros: Good benefits and wages aren't bad either.
cons: Company culture not collaborative and inclusive.

review_title: Good place to start your career
pros:
Loan repayment 
Learning opportunities 
No contract
cons:
Lower pay
5 years to vest retirement
